message.content:
cs.SI, cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.HC, cs.CY 

The paper discusses the use of citations as indicators of quality in research, which is relevant to several sub-fields in computer science. Specifically, the paper explores the distinction between short-term and long-term citation impact, which is relevant to the sub-field of information retrieval (cs.IR) and digital libraries (cs.DL). The paper also discusses the role of citations in codifying knowledge claims, which is relevant to the sub-field of human-computer interaction (cs.HC) and cybernetics (cs.CY). Finally, the paper uses empirical data to support its arguments, which is relevant to the sub-field of social informatics (cs.SI).
